dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5163 IH: To prohibit camping on public property in the District of Columbia.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Timmons introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To prohibit camping on public property in the District of Columbia.

section.header: Prohibition on camping on public property in District of Columbia

subsection.text: Beginning on and after the date of the enactment of this Act, it shall be unlawful in the District of Columbia to camp outdoors on public property.
Any person who violates subsection (a) shall be fined not more than $500, imprisoned for not more than 30 days, or both.
In this section, the term camp means to use any material to set up, maintain, or establish a temporary place of abode.
